turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hi there. Good morning.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, I'm Doctor <UNSURE>Deen Mirza</UNSURE> from GP at Hand. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Lovely to meet you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, before we start your appointment. Can I please confirm your full name and date of birth?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh my name is, Tracy Chapman, and, um, my date of birth is.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>God</UNSURE> <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. <UNIN/>, I'm forty five.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Just tell me how old you are.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, OK. Uh, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> could you <UNSURE>just</UNSURE> confirm the first line of your address, and your postcode?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, fifteen Babylon Street. Um, W six five <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's great, OK, thank you. Um, are you in a private place where you're OK to speak at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, fantastic. All right, so tell me what's been going on. You said you're, a bit short of breath. Is that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, feeling very sort of breathless recently.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, <UNIN/> like, I don't know, whenever I like breathe deeply, I, it sort of catches in, in the, right-hand side of my back.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK, OK. And how long has this been going on for now?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Just, just today really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Any other symptoms at the same time, uh, that you've had this pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, well I've had a <UNIN/>, I've got a bit of slight fever, um, and, and, uh, well like, I coughed up a bit of blood on, on two occasions.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> what that means.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. <UNIN/>, well it might, it might all be connected then. Um, and um, yesterday, before this, all of this, were you completely fine?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, yeah, kind of, I <UNIN/>, I, I can sort of feel my heart beating, but <UNIN/>, other than that, no, sort of fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So you can feel your heart kind of, um, beating a little bit, bit faster, do you think than normal? Is that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, I don't know I can just sort of feel it, more <UNIN/>, you know. Um, but I've, I've also, I've been feeling a bit, like a bit tired at work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>. Sure.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Haven't really been, like exercising has been a bit difficult, because I've been feeling tired.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and, <UNIN/>, yeah <UNSURE>performing</UNSURE>, <UNIN/>, performing daily activities has, has been a bit harder than usual.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. OK, all right. <UNIN/>, and um, how long has that been for? The tiredness and, you know, <UNIN/>, not wanting to exercise <UNSURE>and</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, <UNIN/>, only after, only for a couple of weeks or so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Couple of weeks, OK. And then, and the last day or so that's when you get the cough and the pain in the side? And you've cough <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> blood, OK, all right. Um, you said you felt a bit warm. <UNIN/>, have you measured your temperature at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, with the back of <UNSURE>my</UNSURE>, my hand, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> just <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> with that, OK, fair enough, all right. Um, OK. And now, can I just ask? Um, do you smoke at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. What do you work as?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I work in an office, just a, desk job.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, all right. And, um, do you live alone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. In a flat or a house?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Flat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you have any pets?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Cat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: A cat, OK. Um, uh, uh, are you on, any medication at all? Regular medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, um, <UNIN/>, Methotrexate, Methotrexate, that's.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Methotrexate. OK. <UNIN/>, what are you on that for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I've, I've got SLE.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: SLE, OK. Do you have any other <UNIN/>, diagnoses? Any other illnesses at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. Um, and do you have any allergies to any medication?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any other allergies at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So, um, you're on, you're taking Methotrexate at the moment. When was the last time you had Methotrexate?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, this morning.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Ohh, you had it this morning. OK, <UNSURE>ohh</UNSURE> right, all right.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um <UNIN/>, um, couple of things I'd like to do in order to try and um, get an idea of how, unwell you are.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, the first thing I'd like to do, is to try and measure your pulse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, what, the way we're gonna do this, is that, if you're, if I can get you to try and locate the pulse in your wrist.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>. Not everyone can do this, so don't worry if you can't.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But if you, if you can tell me whether you can feel the regular pulse. It's just under the thumb. If you put two fingers up and down like that, you might be able to feel the pulse.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I've got it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You got it, OK. Are you sure?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. So what I'm going to do, is I'm going to tell you when to start counting, and when to stop counting OK. So I'll just get my stopwatch up.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So if you can, um, you've still got the pulse?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. So if you can start counting, now please.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: One, two, three.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Five, six, <UNIN/>, eight, <UNIN/>, ten, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: If you can stop now, <UNIN/>. That, I think that was about eleven or twelve. Um, so that would make your heart rate about, sixty six to seventy four, that's, that's OK, good.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fantastic. And the next thing I'd like you to try and do, OK. Um, it depends on the lighting, so it may not be possible.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But <UNSURE>the</UNSURE> next thing I'd like you to try and do is just, to get you to squeeze the tip of your finger.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And then let me see how quickly the redness come back. OK, so if you can see what I'm doing now. My finger's come, right behind the screen, I'm squeezing it, OK. <UNIN/>, just watch me first, it's all right, just watch me first. Yeah, I'm, I'm squeezing it.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And then you can see, that, it goes, pale and then it goes back to the normal red colour, OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So if I can get you just to put your finger up to the, your camera. And then with the other hand, just try and squeeze it, and <UNSURE>see</UNSURE><INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: You <UNSURE>look</UNSURE> like you've got very good circulation.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, perfect, that's great. Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The last thing I'd like to do, is I'd like <UNIN/>, to <UNIN/>, try and have a look down your throat.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Are, are you doing this consultation via, um, a phone or a <UNIN/>, laptop?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Phone.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: A phone?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> rested it on my laptop, so I think we're good to go.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>, sorry, say that again.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Got it rested the laptop but I can.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, <UNIN/>, OK. So if you, if you, um, position your device up above your head, put your head back, mouth open wide, and let me see if I can have a <UNIN/>. That's, <UNSURE>fantastic</UNSURE>. And say ah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Perfect. Thank you for that. Excellent.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Lovely.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Last thing, is if I can get you to feel inside your neck. Just on the sides here, OK, um, by your Adam's apple. Tell me whether you can feel any enlarged glands or not.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, they feel pretty normal to me.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now, um, uh, <UNIN/>. Sorry, I've forgotten your name.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, Doris.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Doris, OK Doris. Um, so, so Doris, um, what, what I think we need to do, is um. This sounds like you might have a chest infection.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. If you're coughing up blood, and you're feeling your heart racing. Um.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, I think, you need to be examined today, someone needs to listen to your chest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And, um, maybe check your blood pressure as well, check that, you're stable. I have to say examining you now, from what limited, examination I could do online.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You're, everything does seem to be OK, in terms of, you, you don't seem acutely unstable.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: However, if you've got, this kind of pain, um, when taking a deep breath in and you're coughing up blood. We do, do, we do need to assess you to figure out whether you have <UNSURE>a</UNSURE> Pneumonia or chest infection.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And um, that would involve someone listening to your chest with a stethoscope, and you may need um, an antibiotic. Uh, there's one thing I need to ask you. Have you been, on any long-haul flight recently?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Have you ever had any clots in your legs, or clots in your lung? Blood clots?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not that I know of, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Anyone in the family have that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. All right. Um, what I think we'll do is um, we'll arrange for you to get reviewed in a clinic today.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, I would like someone to listen to your chest, and check your blood pressure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And to, to recheck your pulse as well. Just make <UNSURE>sure</UNSURE>, and check your temperature, make sure all those parameters <UNSURE>are</UNSURE> OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You may well need an antibiotic, OK. Um, do you have any allergies to any antibiotics?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, OK. Um, I, I'm not, I'm gonna, not, I'm not going to prescribe anything for you now, because I think you need to have that, basic assessment first.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, before we proceed to the next step. But the, that's what I would predict the next step might be. Um, I'm going to leave the number in the notes for this appointment, for you to ring our support team.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And then, they will, book you in for a face-to-face appointment with one of our GPs today.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And <UNSURE>then</UNSURE>, they'll do that assessment, and then we'll take it from there, OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: But we don't think I'm dying of lung cancer.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, uh, given the, the way in which you uh, have presented now. Just one day, with a fever and, this slight pain, <UNIN/>, concurrent with the, the blood in the, the, the flem.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's not usually how lung cancer is <UNSURE>presented</UNSURE>. It's more insidious, over a longer period of time, with other symptoms.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, however, we might need to get some investigations to exclude that. It depends on the examination finding, when we see you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right. <UNIN/>, are you worried about lung cancer?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Well you know, you start coughing up blood and you think you're, gonna, die of lung cancer, so.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Sure, of course yeah. So, just remind me how old you are again. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Forty five.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Forty five, OK. It's something we do need to be cognisant of, OK. Um, and, we may end up having to do a follow-up chest X-ray, if things don't settle down. But at the moment, it, it seems more like a chest infection, rather than a lung cancer.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That's good to know.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, that, that is good to know, yeah, so that's, 'cause that's easier to treat. But we still need to make sure that things are OK because, chest infections can become nasty as well.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>It</UNSURE> can lead to infection inside the body, <UNIN/>, we want to avoid that as well. So, let's get you checked out today, and hopefully we can put your mind to rest, <UNSURE>and</UNSURE> get you on the right course of treatment.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Perfect. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: All right, you're welcome. All right, take care then. All the best.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Bye.
